snippet: A short-term strategy to slow global warming is to reduce emissions of other pollutants.
abstract: Op-Ed article by environmental experts Durwood J Zaelke and Prof Veerabhadran Ramanathan contends that reducing emissions of black carbon, methane, ozone and hydrofluorocarbons would be good short-term strategy for slowing global warming; urges Pres Obama to use his executive authority to reduce these pollutants, which would produce fast results and create sense of urgent optimism about climate threat.

byline.original: By DURWOOD J. ZAELKE and VEERABHADRAN RAMANATHAN

lead_paragraph: A short-term strategy to slow global warming is to reduce emissions of other pollutants.
